events.description: An alien ship leaves Earth as an emergency procedure when humans arrive nearby.
events.discussion: Discuss pros and cons of emergency procedures.

events.description: ET manages to get into the family’s shed.
events.discussion: Discuss access control concerns on a residential property, and the risks unauthorised access could bring.

events.description: Michael incorrectly identifies the footprints on the ground as belonging to a coyote.
events.discussion: Discuss the importance of correctly identifying a potential intruder.

events.description: When Elliot exits the house to look for the intruder, both the house and the shed’s doors are unlocked.
events.discussion: Discuss the security of residential property and the issues unlocked doors could lead to.

events.description: Elliot follows footprints to find the intruder.
events.discussion: Discuss the topic of traceability, and in what context this can be considered a positive or negative property to have.

events.description: Elliot leaves a trace of sweets for the intruder to follow.
events.discussion: Discuss method of social engineering used to lead a party to behave in a specific way, in line with the social engineer’s goals. Discuss how these are used to lure attackers into systems (honeypots) and their usefulness.

events.description: The police are performing surveillance of private communications amongst the residents of an area identified as potential hiding place of an alien.
events.discussion:
Discuss the rights of the police to surveil families as they do in the movie, and the expectation of privacy a citizen has.
Further discuss this in light of issues of national security.

events.description: Security forces enter Elliot’s house with no authorization.
events.discussion: Discuss the regulatory aspects of this scene – for instance, why don’t the security forces have a warrant to enter the premises?

events.description: Michael and Elliot take control of the vehicle holding ET without authorisation.
events.discussion: Discuss what security measures failed for the two boys to be able to drive away with the vehicle.
